The International Olympic Committee's official abbreviation for the Congo is CCGO. ==History== The National Olympic Committee for the Congo (Comit√© National Olympique et Sportif Congolais) was formed in 1964 and recognized by the International Olympic Committee the same year. The Republic of the Congo, competing as Congo, was first at the Olympic Games in 1964. Competitors from the Congo missed the 1968 Summer Olympics and boycotted the 1976 Summer Olympics along with most other African nations. Congo has been in the Winter Olympic Games since 1988. As of 2012, no athlete from Congo has ever won an Olympic medal. ==Related pages== * List of IOC country codes == References == ==Other websites == * Republic of Congo profile at London2012.com Category:Sport in the Republic of the Congo Category:Nations at the Olympics
